title: How to Make Vegetarian Hot Pot

steps.headline: Combine the ginger and garlic and cook in your broth.
steps.description: To start, use a dutch oven to combine the ginger and the garlic in the vegetable broth. They should be simmered for about 15 minutes over medium heat. When you're done, you can discard the ginger and garlic. You just need the flavor for your hot pot. Turn the pot off and set aside for now. If you don't have a dutch oven, you can use a skillet or a soup pot.

steps.headline: Heat the oil and add the mushrooms, red pepper, and bok choy stems.
steps.description: Heat your canola oil over medium-high heat in a large non-stick skillet. When it's hot, throw in the mushrooms and red pepper. Throw in one mushroom or red pepper to test the oil's heat. It should simmer slightly if it's hot enough for cooking. Cook the mushrooms and red peppers for 2 to 3 minutes or until they're tender. Stir them often while cooking them. Once the mushrooms and red peppers are tender, add the bok choy stems to the mixture.

steps.headline: Add the mushroom mixture and noodles to the broth.
steps.description: Once you've cooked the mushrooms, red peppers, and bok choy stems, add them to the broth. You can also add your noodles at this point. Reduce the heat on your stove the medium-low setting. Simmer the hot pot for about 15 minutes. This should cook the noodles and vegetables.

steps.headline: Add the remaining bok choy and tofu.
steps.description: After this, you should simmer the pot until everything is heated. This should take about 2 more minutes. However, times may vary slightly depending on the precise heat of your stove top.

steps.headline: Stir in the remaining ingredients.
steps.description: Add the carrots, soy sauce, and sesame oil. Then, add vinegar until you get your desired taste. You can garnish your hot pot with scallions when you serve it. Keep the heat on medium low until everything is mixed in, and then switch off the burner and serve your hot pot.

steps.headline: Preheat your pot.
steps.description: You should use a four quart pot. Allow it to heat over a stove set to medium-heat. When it's heated, water should sizzle slightly when tossed in the pot.

steps.headline: Mix the cornstarch and broth.
steps.description: Add your broth to the pot, holding back one cup. Mix the cornstarch into that cup. Then, add this cup to the rest of the broth and stir everything together.

steps.headline: Sautee the onion and pepper.
steps.description: You should sautee your onion and pepper in oil in a large skillet. Use a pinch of salt for taste. Cook the onions and pepper until the onions are tender. This should take about five minutes.

steps.headline: Toss in the garlic, ginger, lemongrass, and red pepper flakes.
steps.description: Add this to your onions and pepper. Cook until it gives off a fragrant odor. This usually takes around a minute.

steps.headline: Add the remaining ingredients besides the coconut milk and lime.
steps.description: Add the broth and cornstarch mixture to the pot where you sauteed the other ingredients. Add the rest of ingredients except for the coconut milk and lime. Keep the mixture over medium heat and stir continually until it thickens. Times will vary, but it usually takes around 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Bring the pot to a boil and then simmer for half an hour.
steps.description: Cover the pot and turn up the heat. Allow it to come to a boil. Once it's boiling, reduce the heat to a simmer and allow the hot pot to cook for about half an hour. You should make sure the mushrooms are completely tender before you finish cooking.

steps.headline: Add the remaining ingredients and serve.
steps.description: Add the the coconut milk and lime. You can stir in the coconut milk and lime once the hot pot has cooked. You should add salt to taste. You can garnish your hot pot with fresh herbs.

steps.headline: Prepare the noodles.
steps.description: Prepare whichever type of noodles you're using according to the directions on the package. Different types of noodles require different methods of cooking, so refer to your package's instructions. Once you've cooked your noodles, set them aside.

steps.headline: Wash and prepare your vegetables and tofu.
steps.description: You should be sure to wash your vegetables under clean tap water. Rinse off any dirt or debris. Then, chop them up as needed for the recipe. You should also cut your tofu into cubes.

steps.headline: Sautee the onions and mushrooms.
steps.description: Use a little vegetable oil. Sautee the onions and mushrooms over medium heat until they're slightly browned. Then, set them aside for later.

steps.headline: Simmer the liquids and some vegetables in a large pot.
steps.description: Using a large pot, measure out and add the water, mirin, sake, and sugar. Simmer until the sugar is dissolved and then add the broccoli and carrots. Allow everything to simmer for a few minutes. Then, add the bok choy and cabbage. Allow everything to simmer for a few minutes before proceeding.

steps.headline: Mix in the green onions, mushrooms, noodles, and tofu.
steps.description: Turn the heat to low before adding these ingredients. Allow the hot pot to simmer until everything is cooked until just tender. The time will vary depending on the precise heat of your stove, but it should not take longer than a few minutes. Once everything is cooked, you can turn the heat off and serve your hot pot.

Simmer the liquids and some vegetables in a large pot. Using a large pot, measure out and add the water, mirin, sake, and sugar. Allow everything to simmer for a few minutes before proceeding. Mix in the green onions, mushrooms, noodles, and tofu. Turn the heat to low before adding these ingredients. Allow the hot pot to simmer until everything is cooked until just tender. The time will vary depending on the precise heat of your stove, but it should not take longer than a few minutes.
